author: @syremusic_
text: For those having issues with twitterscraper not returning anything - it's broken. The library "twitterscraper" is currently broken (check the github).   What bothers me is that Alex, the creator of this video, is clearly avoiding the question in the comments, and is saying things like "I haven't had time to research this". A 30 second search will give you the answer to why twitterscraper isn't working.  There is a working alternative, and I'll let you find it yourself (again, check the GitHub).

author: @AlexTheAnalyst
text: Scraping Data From Twitter: 0:59 Transforming Data: 1:52 Visualizing Data: 3:35  A lot of people are commenting that it doesn’t work. As of 12/1/2020 the package that I’m using is not working. I believe Twitter made some updates on their end that caused this library to stop working. I do apologize, but hope you can underrating I created this before the change. If anyone discovers a fix to this and is able to use this Library please let me know!   Look at https://spacy.io/usage for issues with the Spacy packages. For "0 Tweets" try this link: https://github.com/taspinar/twitterscraper/pull/337/commits/2233682b3c04840531a94ba8ee3c3325d7bf6b4a#diff-84e7bb41f8dfc0c9956b29d20320e1bcR1
